intro: Clidemia chaetocalyx, commonly known as the velvetleaf or false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers, which are usually pink or white, bloom in clusters and are accompanied by bracts that are often more showy than the actual flowers. Clidemia chaetocalyx is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in shaded, moist environments.
